result.execSummary:
The defendant Solomon J. Snow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharges. *Comply with any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. *Bond of $150.00 on file to be applied and the balance paid directly to the Clerk of Courts Office within 60 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Solomon J. Snow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Solomon J. Snow in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to accept the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Bond to be applied
Fines/costs to be paid directly to Clerk of Courts Office within 60 days
Plea hearing on October 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Solomon J. Snow in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz was hoping to follow up with the Human Services Dept. and Atty Hendee; is to remain on the trial calendar.

BY THE COURT:  Jury Trial will remain on the calendar.
bond continued.

Return date on July 20, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on September 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on October 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Solomon J. Snow in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz would like the court to address the NGI plea.
Court received the report from Dr. Bernie.  Atty Gumz does not object to the court receiving the report.
Atty Gumz asks the court to continue the Not Guilty plea and set for trial.  Atty Gumz withdraws the NGI plea.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of the NGI plea.

BY THE COURT:  NGI plea withdrawn.  Not Guilty plea accepted.
Set for Return, Jury Trial and FPT.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
for Psychological Evaluation

Atty Hendee states that all parties have received the evaluation.  Atty Gumz states that the report does not support the NGI plea; the defense withdraws the NGI plea at this time and asks for a return date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
plea will be covered when the defendant is in court at the next hearing.  Return date scheduled for May 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
